meanings.definition: Moving or extending toward a lower position.
meanings.sent1: The downward slope made it easy to roll the ball down.
meanings.sent2: The stairs had a downward angle, making it challenging to climb up.
meanings.sent3: The downward slide at the playground was a favorite among the children.
meanings.sent4: Her mood took a downward turn after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The downward arrow on the map indicated the direction to go.

meanings.definition: Directed or moving toward a lower place or position.
meanings.sent1: The downward motion of the elevator was smooth and quiet.
meanings.sent2: The airplane started its downward descent towards the airport.
meanings.sent3: The downward trend in sales worried the business owners.
meanings.sent4: His downward gaze indicated his shyness in the social gathering.
meanings.sent5: The downward path through the forest led to a hidden waterfall.
